s.text: So many Modernist breakthroughs involved the visual dismantling of a woman--Picasso's Demoiselles d'Avignon (1907) on the second floor of MoMA, de Kooning's Woman, I (1950-51) on the third--that it should come as no surprise that LŽger began the same way, with his systematically fragmented Woman in Blue (1912), the first piece in the exhibition.
